listeningQuestion.question: Why is Mr. Thompson selling the pub?
listeningQuestion.translation: 汤普森先生为什么要卖掉这个酒吧？

editorNotes: 本课讲述了一个关于闹鬼酒吧的有趣故事。文章通过汤普森先生的经历，生动地描述了一个'贪杯的鬼魂'的所作所为。在语法方面，重点介绍了情态动词must的用法，以及一些常见的时间表达方式。文章还涉及了一些重要的词汇用法，如haunt、suggest、accept等。

dialogueText.heading: 课文
notes: A public house which was recently bought by Mr. Ian Thompson is up for sale.
Mr.Thompson is going to sell it because it is haunted.
He told me that he could not go to sleep one night because he heard a strange noise coming from the bar.
The next morning, he found that the doors had been blocked by chairs and the furniture had been moved.
Though Mr.Thompson had turned the lights off before he went to bed, they were on in the morning.
He also said that he had found five empty whisky bottles which the ghost must have drunk the night before.
When I suggested that some villagers must have come in for a free drink, Mr.Thompson shook his head.
The villagers have told him that they will not accept the pub even if he gives it away.

translation.heading: 翻译
notes: 伊恩·汤普森先生最近才买的一个小酒店现在又要卖出去。
汤普森先生之所以想卖它，是因为那里常闹鬼。
他告诉我有天夜里他怎么也睡不着，因为他听到酒吧里传来一阵奇怪的响声。
第二天早上，他发现酒吧间的门被椅子堵上了，家具也被挪动过。
虽然汤普森临睡觉时把灯关了，但早晨灯却都亮着。
他还说他发现了5只空的威士忌瓶子，肯定是鬼魂昨天晚上喝的。
当我暗示说一定是村里有些人来喝不花钱的酒时，汤普森先生摇了摇头。
村里的人已经告诉他，即使他把小酒店白送人，他们也不要。

notes.title: 情态动词must的用法
content: must + 动词原形：表示必须做某事
must + have + 过去分词：表示对过去事情的推测
must be：表示对现在情况的推测
must have been：表示对过去情况的推测

notes.title: 感官动词用法
content: hear/see/feel/watch/notice + 宾语 + 现在分词：表示动作正在进行
hear/see/feel/watch/notice + 宾语 + 动词原形：表示动作已经发生
例如：I heard someone knocking at the door.（我听到有人正在敲门）

notes.example: A public house which was recently bought by Mr. Ian Thompson is up for sale.
When I suggested that some villagers must have come in for a free drink, Mr.Thompson shook his head.
They will not accept the pub even if he gives it away.
I won't have dinner with him even if he pays for it.

multipleChoice.question: In Mr. Thompson's opinion, the ghost ___ whisky.
multipleChoice.explanation: must + 动词原形可以表示推测，表示'很可能'的意思。

fillInBlanks.sentence: The pub is ___ for sale because it is haunted.

notes.title: 文化背景
notes.content: 在英国，pub（public house的缩写）是重要的社交场所，不仅是喝酒的地方，也是人们聚会、交流的场所。每个pub都有其独特的氛围和历史，有些pub甚至会有闹鬼的传说，这些传说往往成为pub的特色之一。

notes.title: 实用表达
notes.content: 本课中的一些表达方式在日常英语中非常实用，如'up for sale'（待售）、'shake one's head'（摇头）等。这些表达不仅用于书面语，在口语交际中也经常使用。
